Question
========

We want to test the hypothesis H~0~: μ~1~= μ~2~ against the one-sided alternative H~1~:μ~1~ \< μ~2~ with risk α = 0.05, using a pooled T-test. To this end, we draw two samples, both of size 10, from the corresponding populations. The limit of the critical area is then

----------

* -2.1009
* -2.086
* -1.7341
* -1.7247

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* -2.1009: Incorrect
* -2.086: Incorrect
-1.7341: Correct
-1.7247: Incorrect
